channel.title: Nature
channel.description: Nature is the foremost international weekly scientific journal in the world and is the flagship journal for Nature Portfolio. It publishes the finest peer-reviewed research in all fields of science and technology on the basis of its originality, importance, interdisciplinary interest, timeliness, accessibility, elegance and surprising conclusions. Nature publishes landmark papers, award winning news, leading comment and expert opinion on important, topical scientific news and events that enable readers to share the latest discoveries in science and evolve the discussion amongst the global scientific community.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Dispersion-engineered multipass optical parametric amplification
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 05 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09665-w

A multipass optical parametric amplifier leverages dispersion-engineered dielectric mirrors to overcome the gain versus bandwidth trade-off and achieve broadband amplification with high gain within a compact device.
item.dc:title: Dispersion-engineered multipass optical parametric amplification
item.dc:creator: Jan H. Nägele
Tobias Steinle
Johann Thannheimer
Philipp Flad
Harald Giessen

item.title: Vector-stimuli-responsive magnetorheological fibrous materials
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 05 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09706-4

Vector-stimuli-responsive magnetorheological fibrous materials can be mass-produced, which can be assembled into yarns and woven into a variety of fabrics with actuation and stiffening abilities.
item.dc:title: Vector-stimuli-responsive magnetorheological fibrous materials
item.dc:creator: Junhong Pu
Haiqiong Li
Jin Liu
Ke Li
Xiaoming Tao

item.title: Millisecond lifetimes and coherence times in 2D transmon qubits
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 05 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09687-4

A materials platform using tantalum as a base layer and silicon as the substrate to construct superconducting qubits enables device performance improvements such as millisecond lifetimes and coherence times, as well as high time-averaged quality factors.
item.dc:title: Millisecond lifetimes and coherence times in 2D transmon qubits
item.dc:creator: Matthew P. Bland
Faranak Bahrami
Jeronimo G. C. Martinez
Paal H. Prestegaard
Basil M. Smitham
Atharv Joshi
Elizabeth Hedrick
Shashwat Kumar
Ambrose Yang
Alexander C. Pakpour-Tabrizi
Apoorv Jindal
Ray D. Chang
Guangming Cheng
Nan Yao
Robert J. Cava
Nathalie P. de Leon
Andrew A. Houck

item.title: Ultrashort laser pulse amplified by back-and-forth propagation
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 05 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03449-y

It is challenging to generate ultrashort laser pulses at high powers, but repeatedly overlapping light pulses in a crystal can efficiently amplify a weak signal.
item.dc:title: Ultrashort laser pulse amplified by back-and-forth propagation
item.dc:creator: Christoph Heyl
Marc Hanna

item.title: Artificial brains with less drain
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 31 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03514-6

Biologically inspired electronic neurons could boost the efficiency of artificial-intelligence systems.
item.dc:title: Artificial brains with less drain
